page.title: 12Wotter Local history
page.content: A few Bronze agehut circles remain on the moor. Similar circles which were in danger of obliteration by china clay spoil were recently exavated and one was removed to Tavistock school. The Plymouth and Launceston railway ceased to run through the area iv 1963 and the industrial tram line from the china clay works was dismantled earlier. During World War II German bombers used 3 white china clay spoil heaps as markers for their raids on Plymouth. Two of these heaps,now overgrown are near Wotter. China clay waste is very infertile and erodes badly so ettempts at camouflage involved covering the slopes with nets and planting specially chosen plants in the holes. Mass felling of trees in great Shaugh Wood was also part of the war effort.
